title: How to Open and Edit XML Files

steps.title: Purchase an XML editor.
steps.content: Purchase an XML editor. There are a number of XML editors available, including Liquid XML Editor .

steps.title: Install your chosen XML editor on your computer.
steps.content: Install your chosen XML editor on your computer.

steps.title: Familiarize yourself with your XML editor's workspace.
steps.content: Familiarize yourself with your XML editor's workspace.

steps.title: Familiarize yourself with user resources associated with your XML editor, such as websites and online user forums.
steps.content: Familiarize yourself with user resources associated with your XML editor, such as websites and online user forums.

steps.title: Locate the XML file you wish to edit.
steps.content: Locate the XML file you wish to edit.

steps.title: Open the file you wish to edit by double clicking the file name.
steps.content: Open the file you wish to edit by double clicking the file name. The file will open and display the existing code.

steps.title: Review your editing.
steps.content: Review your editing. Be sure all XML elements have an opening and closing tag. Keep in mind that XML tags are case sensitive. Be sure your XML file contains one root element. Be sure the attribute values within your XML file are surrounded by quotation marks. Attributes are items within the XML code that provide further information about an element that is not available elsewhere in the data. Be sure all XML elements are properly nested.

steps.title: Correct any errors you discover when reviewing your XML file.
steps.content: Correct any errors you discover when reviewing your XML file.

steps.title: Use your XML editor's validating tool to validate your XML file.
steps.content: Use your XML editor's validating tool to validate your XML file. Your XML document will not run if it contains errors.

steps.title: Correct any errors identified during file validation.
steps.content: Correct any errors identified during file validation.

steps.title: Save your newly edited XML file.
steps.content: Save your newly edited XML file.

steps.title: View your XML file in a web browser.
steps.content: View your XML file in a web browser. If your XML file is invalid, it will not display.
